I have multiple other synthetics, and none present the issue anywhere near the level of this shirt.  So I can only conclude it's something with the specific fabric of this shirt. review.reviewBody:
I was very surprised by how light yet comfortable this fabric is. Very breathable for the hotter temps we get here in Utah, I like these a lot better than my other pairs of mtb shorts with thiccccc fabric. The shorts are comfy, I like the length and the fit is very flattering (haha far more so than the kinda bad product pictures here on this backcountry.com webpage). 

Because this is a European brand, I always have to size up bc I am curvy with muscular thighs and bum. I require a size M.
review.name: Comfy, Cute, Lightweight

review.reviewBody: I am a huge fan of these shorts. They are lightweight, very stretchy, and extremely comfy. Overall, they fit pretty true to size, I am usually a medium across the board (5'4' and 135lb) and wear a medium in these as well.
review.name: Big Fan

review.reviewBody: I love the fit of these shorts - they maybe run a little small, but also have a decent amount of stretch in them and the length and cut are both ideal. They feel like way higher quality than the price suggests - especially considering they're made with recycled materials.
review.name: High quality for the price

review.reviewBody: These MTB shorts are great, I have worn mine a few times. I love the pockets and the length. They seem to run a little snug, I have a small and wish I sized up to a Medium, but a lot of European brands seem to run small. Great shorts and with a great sustainability story.
review.name: loving these

name: Vellir Stretch Short - Women's

description: Buy the Simms Dry Creek Z 25L Backpack online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Dry Creek Z 25L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Simms Dry Creek Z 25L Backpack online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Just the right size to put everything inside, very light but sturdy still.
review.name: Great Backpack

review.reviewBody:
I the Dry creek Z back pack after I slid off a rock and went in the river, I had to drain my Fly boxes and gear. I compared this to a similar fishpond pack a friend has.
Pros:  It fits well with all day comfort it has good side pockets for a water bottle, a good net holder, the outer pocket is nice, two internal pockets help divide contents, good molly webbing on the waist straps, Good main  cargo holder, able to fit extra layers in it after the days warm up.
Cons: there is no way to use the lower pocket to hold an extra rod with out buying an additional strap to hold the top secure. the outside is tight with 4 spare spools of tippet and a pack of weights( but I use the small maxima leader spools). The internal pockets are too deep and should be divided. there maybe should be an accessory pack for the back internal pocket that would hold leaders, weights, fly boxes, indicators>>>). No internal phone or key pocket. Not many options to hold forceps on cutters on shoulder straps, the one provided ends up on the top of your shoulder making it hard to use. the waist belt where molly straps are could be a bit longer and come around a bit more.    Overall I still like the pack and use it frequently.
review.name: Dry Creek Z Backpack

review.reviewBody:
Really enjoying using it in the salt water, zipper is smooth and easy to use.
I like the side storage pockets great for Big water bottles and also for carrying rod tubes 
The only thing that needs to be added are straps on the side lash points.
review.name: Great waterproof Pack

review.reviewBody: Great bag. I tried it solid, I fell into the river with water up to my neck and the contents remained very dry. very efficient and very solid manufacturing
review.name: Really good bag for hard rainning day and swimming into the river ðŸ˜€

review.reviewBody: Bought this as an all-around pack while on the go. Recently used as a boat bag for a winter float and it was plenty big enough for my boxes, extra layers, and water bottle. Everything stayed dry, the exterior side pockets were clutch, and the pack was comfortable. My only wish is it were a bit more structured so it would sit up better on its own, and think it would look a little more refined. Overall, great pack!
review.name: Solid pack as advertised

review.reviewBody: Great size. Very well made. New zipper is a big upgrade, especially when exposed to saltwater. Removable waist strap could be used as a wading belt in  a pinch.
review.name: Dry Creek Z Backpack

review.reviewBody: The Dry Creek Z backpack is perfect for adventures where you want certain items dry. The backpack is light weight, comfortable and easy to use. The side water bottle holders are the perfect size.
review.name: Dry Creek Z backpack

review.reviewBody: This backpack is awesome! The addition of the side pockets is great and the additional and more roomy pockets in the backpack are perfect for keeping gear more protected from wet elements. Every time I wear it on the water, folks comment that they would like one of their own.
review.name: Awesome backpack!

review.reviewBody: First impression is this new zipper.  This waterproof zipper is amazing, very easy to pull and lock.  This alone is a significant improvement and worth the money.  The pack fits great and is the perfect size for a full day on the flats.  I inflate the pack and wear it on my chest to swim out to bonefish flats that require a swim.  The pack stayed completely waterproof.  Nice work on this one Simms
review.name: Check out the zipper on this bag!

review.reviewBody: I need a backpack to go fishing, not camping. I need the z sling but backpack, something small, that can hold a big net, super simple and dry. Almost like the old dry creek z backpack but a bit smaller and without the bottle pockets, donâ€™t worry, if I want to carry a bottle of water Iâ€™ll put it inside or hook it to the pack. Thanks!
review.name: It would be better without the outside pockets, like it used to be.

name: Dry Creek Z 25L Backpack

review.reviewBody: Purchased my 4th pair of BD Traverse poles for either myself or my family. They are the standard by which all other adjustable ski/backcountry poles are measured. Reliable, durable and a good value.
review.name: Traverse Pole Review

review.reviewBody: These are solid glad I picked them up working great so far
review.name: These are solid glad I

review.reviewBody: Great poles. I'm starting to think that buying them on Backcountry was a mistake because BACKCOUNTRY WON'T STOP SPAMMING ME TO ASK ME TO REVIEW THEIR PRODUCT..
review.name: Poles

review.reviewBody: I use the poles as a ski instructor. Often kids want to try out poles. I change the length of the poles and try a few runs. They love it. They are happy.
review.name: Sturdy adjustable ski poles

review.reviewBody: Took them out in the backcountry last weekend. They work great. The basket is a good size for powder and they seem pretty sturdy. I'm 5.9 and use the 145 cm which is perfect.
review.name: Bought traverse ski poles for backcountry skiing

review.reviewBody: After beating on my original pair for about ten years, I finally broke one of them while trying to take out a bend I caused in a hard tumble pulling a sled in the backcountry. These are super rugged, easy to use with mittens/gloves on, and guaranteed to hold up in the backcountry.
review.name: The original, the bes

review.reviewBody: Great ski pole, love the grips at both the handles and midway down the pole. One star off because the dang snow baskets were so difficult to get on and there were zero installation instructions. Had to use YouTube. That being said, once they were properly installed, they said on thru deep snow and fast speeds.
review.name: Great ski pole, love the

name: Traverse Ski Poles

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fast shipping. Quality product.ordered a hoodie as well. Very pleased.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Sturdy shoes that are breathable and supportive. I haven't gotten to hike in them yet, but I expect that they will provide good grip on rocky/slippery slopes.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great shoe-- I just received my second pair!!! Well made and COMFORTABLE!!!!!

hasVariant.description: Buy the Castelli Espresso Bib Short - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Normally wear XL in other brands. This felt like a medium.  Just be aware
review.name: Super super Small

review.reviewBody: I'm 5'7" and 165 pounds and purchased this bib short (XL) and the Castelli Entrata 2 bib short (XL) as well. The Espresso fit is okay, but I wish there was a bit more length to the shoulder straps as they felt a bit snug, even for my "lofty" stature. They are a good hot weather short, but wish there was a bit more support around the thighs. The Progetto X2 Air Seamless pad is good only up to 2 hours of riding and after that I found myself constantly adjusting the pad and felt like the pad simply compressed to the point where I felt every bump in the road. I am somewhat surprised with this experience because I've had better luck with non-bib Castelli shorts. I found that the Kiss 2 pad in the Entrata 2 short provided somewhat better experience than the Progretto X2. Next purchase will be Assos GTS bib shorts.
review.name: Not Impressed

review.reviewBody:
6' / 175lbs / 31" waist size Lg fits perfectly.  In Pearl Izumi and Pactimo I wear Med bibs.
The shorts fit great and fabric is snug w/o being overly tight.
The X2 pad is comfortable and located correctly but not as good as Elastic Interface pads on other bibs I have.
The waist isn't loose and the leg gripper stays put.
The perforated bib straps however are somewhat rough and irritate my nips sometimes.
review.name: Love them except for the bib straps

review.reviewBody:
I know temperature ranges are purely subjective and Castelli lists these in a 59-95 Fahrenheit range, but I would rate them to the 80-85 degree range tops. The fronts are probably one of the highest pair of bibs that I have and is definitely a thicker material which seems to hold in the heat a little more.

Otherwise these are great bibs! The Progretto X2 chamois is well worth the upgrade over the Kiss 2, especially on longer rides.
review.name: Hot, but super comfy

review.reviewBody:
I've ridden them twice, including an 82-mile ride. They are pretty nice.

They are smaller than my other size-M kit, including two pairs of Castelli bib shorts. Not a full size smaller but noticeably, and all over the place: strap length, leg opening, crotch area. For reference I am 5'9", jeans waist 30, and Rapha (etc) in Medium is bang on. Gotta say though that while they felt tight trying them on, once I hit the tarmac they kinda disappeared on me.
review.name: Nice tight shorts

review.reviewBody: These bib shorts are extremely comfortable and hold my genitals securely; no need to re-adjust during a ride. They're even more comfortable than my Assos shorts, which had been the best so far. Unlike previous Castelli shorts, the sizing is correct. A Medium fits me fine while I had to get Large before. All that's left is to see how they hold up. But I'm all set to order a second pair.
review.name: The comfort I deserve

review.reviewBody: This bib is similar to the Endurance 3 bib that I have been wearing for a year, except it is better. It doesn't have that silly fabric elastic band at the cuff, which always stretches out and becomes useless. Instead, the lycra is raw-cut at the bottom. It runs small, same as the Endurance. I wish the straps were a bit longer.
review.name: I like it better than the Endurance

review.reviewBody: Mine are green - I probably could have bought an XXL but the XL is fine.  I bought these to go with Espresso Mocha jersey.  All the photos show both items to be a little lighter than the actually are, but still OK.
review.name: Look great, feel great!

review.reviewBody: this is what a pro kit must feel like. I've worn castelli for years but never the higher end stuff. I ordered both the bib and jersey and couldn't be happier. I guess there really is a difference. highly recommend..
review.name: wow!!!! luxurious and great fit!

name: Espresso Bib Short - Men's

review.reviewBody: Got these and the rubber would not bend at all. Tried wearing them in the shower to break them in. Bore with the pain and tried to climb in them but could never get far. Eventually gave up.
review.name: Rubber was too stiff

review.reviewBody: got these in December to replace my miuras, they run about a full size to size and a half small to start. They are insanely stiff and uncomfortable which I thought would break in slightly and that they'd be great for edging. The edges were rounded off in a little over a month, and months later the shoes are still crazy stiff. The worst of both worlds.
review.name: edge wears out insanely fast

review.reviewBody: I wear a womenâ€™s 6 climbing shoes in all other brands. Somehow even the 7.5 BD shoes is smaller than La Sportiva size 6 when I hold them back to back.  I havenâ€™t been able to wear them on the rock so I canâ€™t say about performance but Iâ€™m expecting itâ€™s quite good if I can find my size. Has anyone else had this experience?
review.name: Sizing seems way off

review.reviewBody: Awesome vest - warm enough paired up with a hoodie or other layers that I don't really need a coat this winter in Pittsburgh.
review.name: Sweet vest

review.reviewBody: My son loves the vest. It does let out a few feathers but he still loves it.
review.name: My son loves it

review.reviewBody: It is perfect for late fall and early winter. It's warm and light.
review.name: Nice vest.

review.reviewBody: It's a Xmas gift so I hv no idea if it's a good product
review.name: Maybe

review.reviewBody: Great vest. It's lightweight but very warm. The fit is true to size. It's great to layer on top of sweaters and I would recommend it
review.name: worth the price and value

review.reviewBody: Exactly what I was looking for. The vest fits and looks great. Plenty warm. A full size puffer vest but not too bulky. Lightweight but not flimsy. I checked out vests made by an handful of North Face competitors but none of them could check all the boxes like the Retro Nuptse Vest. It was more expensive than the others but worth the extra cash. The only thing I wish were different is for the North Face logos to be less prominent. I typically only wear unbranded items so I'd prefer the logos be smaller or just have the one on the back.
review.name: Highly Recommended

review.reviewBody: Love everything about it definitely auh great purchase
review.name: Absolutely

review.reviewBody: I bought this for my son and he love it. He shared is warm and comfy
review.name: Love it.

review.reviewBody: It's light but warm and blocks the wind. Very stylish and goes with almost any outfit.
review.name: I would recommend this product to anyone looking for a vest

review.reviewBody: Love everything. The weight the fabric. So comfy and looks so great over anything.
review.name: I would be this for all my family.

review.reviewBody: Iâ€™ve only taken them on one trip but so far theyâ€™re amazing. The built in belt is a great feature and works perfectly. I donâ€™t wear underwear out on the trail and these shorts are still VERY comfortable.
review.name: Great backpacking shorts

review.reviewBody:
Pros
- technical fabric
- style
- integrated belt that's easy to adjust and undo
- thigh pocket

Cons
- thigh pocket zipper zipper garage to keep the zipper from flapping around is challenging to get the zipper into.  ideally the zipper garage should be be a stiffer rubber material to hold it's shape or the zipper itself should be a self locking zipper when folded.
- the belt loop is a stretchy material that feels weak. The threading is already undone.
review.name: Small areas for improvement

review.reviewBody:
I have had these shorts for a couple months now and so far they are holding up well after several uses for mountain biking and hiking. Stylish enough to wear casually as well. 

Only reason Iâ€™m giving 4 instead of 5 stars is because the zipper pockets arenâ€™t quite big enough to hold an iPhone 13. Nothing wrong with the shorts but would be nice if the pockets were slightly bigger.
review.name: Great for hiking / mountain biking

review.reviewBody:
A solid option for a lightweight, durable short that won't break the bank. I like the built in belt and fit a lot. Been using them on a few hikes now and wet wading fly fishing all with no complaints. 

4/5 stars because I haven't had them long enough to know true long-term durability but not expecting any issues. 

Backcountry - make more color options please! Could use these in some more blues or grays :)
review.name: Solid hot summer short option

review.reviewBody: Love the material and style.  But I bought a small and was swimming in it!  Strangely huge. I'm a muscular guy so they should have been tight if anything, but they were more like wearing a dress than hiking shorts - super baggy legs especially in the rear.  The waist was big, but the built in belt solved that.  Really wanted to love these, but after trying them on and wearing them around, couldn't bring myself to keep them.  Returned (bummer I had to pay return shipping, but that is clear in the return policy)
review.name: Great material & style.  Strange sizing

review.reviewBody:
Gusseted, belted, vented pockets, perfect length. 

Everything you need, nothing you donâ€™t. 

One short to rule them all.
review.name: These are THE shorts

review.reviewBody: These shorts are GREAT. I loved them so much that I bought another pair shortly after receiving my first pair. great color scheme, wears really comfortably/lots of flex, and can be put through the ringer. They're great for both around the house and trekking in some serious terrain. I love the water resistant nature of the short. Highly recommend.
review.name: love so much i bought another pair

review.reviewBody: Love these shorts! perfect material for breathability and stretch. I have used them so far almost everyday this summer from pack rafting to 30 mile hikes in Alaska.
review.name: Wear them daily

review.reviewBody: great shorts, lightweight, length is spot on.  bought a pair a year or two ago and sizing must have changed though, new ones are very tight.  Size large is just barely big enough for me with a ~34in waist.  33 or 34 waist pants/ shorts is generally my size.  probably would go for XL if I get another pair
review.name: Nice shorts, waist is tight

review.reviewBody: I snagged two pair of these shorts and absolutely love them! The belt closure took some getting used to but it actually functions better than other shorts I've owned. It's a huge plus being built into the shorts. They are a perfect length to not get in the way when hiking or running (even biking though I wouldn't choose these over dedicated MTB shorts.) Having 2 zipper pockets is an unexpected bonus for activities where things can fall out easily. The fabric itself is comfortable and sturdy. They dry really quick at the beach as well making them work decent for water activities. These will continue to be my go-to summer shorts without question.
review.name: Favorite Shorts

name: Wasatch Ripstop Short - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Lightweight Synchilla Snap-T Fleece Pullover - Men's
review.reviewBody: Perfect for camping, hiking, or even just wearing around the house, it is so comfy! I would say itâ€™s a step below the Patagonia better sweater as far as warmth but still gets the job done. I wore it around camp with temps in low 30s with only a long sleeve tshirt underneath and was comfortable. My only complaint is there are no pockets, but other than that I love this thing!
review.name: Love this fleece

review.itemreviewed: Lightweight Synchilla Snap-T Fleece Pullover - Men's
review.reviewBody: VERY NICE
review.name: GOODTIME

review.itemreviewed: Lightweight Synchilla Snap-T Fleece Pullover - Men's
review.reviewBody: As I write this, I am wearing a Lightweight Synchilla Snap T that is almost 15 years old and is still in perfect condition.  My wife has one that is more than 20 years old and is still going strong.  They are warm, never go out of style and last forever.  Some people gripe about the lack of pockets = point taken.  The fit is "relaxed", meaning if you want layers underneath, go with your regular size; but if not, you can easily size down.  I wear an XL in everything else Patagonia but I have this one and one of the heavier model both in Size L. Lots of people complain about the lint they throw off; so the first thing you should do with a new one is toss it into the washing machine = problem solved.  Never, never, NEVER put these in the dryer!  Totally unnecessary = they dry in a couple of hours.  There's really only one problem with this iconic garment:  You'd better choose your color carefully, because like being married you're gonna be enjoying the view for a long, LONG time!
review.name: Iconic & Lasts Forever

review.itemreviewed: Lightweight Synchilla Snap-T Fleece Pullover - Men's

review.name: love this!!!!!!

review.reviewBody: Love it I bought a small fits perfect. Get lots of compliments â¤ï¸
review.name: Lightweight

review.reviewBody: Love this jacket!
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody: I love how it's lightweight, roomy, and packable. Pockets are large enough and functional. I usually wear a L in a lot of things but the M works well for me and is still quite loose-fitting and great for layering. It has a shorter more boxy cut, and I like that. The price here was also much lower than anywhere else. I'm happy with it!
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: I live in Vermont and was looking for a good in-between jacket that is both functional and stylish to wear with casual wear and athleisure. This jacket is a great layering piece for my Vermont wardrobe. Comfy and warm in 20/30 degree weather and offers a lot of warmth for being a packable layer. Extra plus is that it's oversized enough to wear around a baby carrier if you're looking for something that can do that!
review.name: Great insulating layer

description: Buy the Smith Convoy Mips Helmet online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Convoy Mips Helmet

hasVariant.name: Convoy Mips Helmet
hasVariant.description: Buy the Smith Convoy Mips Helmet online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I commute by bike at least 5 days a week year round. This helmet was a great upgrade to my old helmet. It fits better, and I like the visor to reduce solar glare. One thing I noticed is the plastic clasp that secures under my chin is harder for my fingers to press and release. It took a bit of getting used to, and I also notice it is getting hard to open now that is below freezing where I live.
review.name: great fitting helmet

review.reviewBody: This Smth helmet fits much more naturally and comfortably on my head vs the Bontrager helmet I had been using.  I didn't know what I was missing.
review.name: Great fit, no fuss, finally

review.reviewBody: Being a motorcycle lover, i've always loved all things Smith. And my Convoy is a perfect example: great fit, visor does not get in the way of your view and it's lightweight! I prefer it over my Fox Speedframe, which is heavier and the visor's too big and sometimes obstructs the view, especially when going downhill. Next helmet will be another Convoy!!
review.name: Love my convoy!

review.reviewBody:
Iâ€™m a skier and know several other skiers and snowboarders who swear by their Smith helmets. When I saw the Smith MIPS helmet on sale I had to purchase it. Very comfortable and solid fit. Exceptional cushioning with no tight areas just a solid feel. 

What I really like is you can put in the helmet and take it by just tightening or loosening the main helmet strap. No guessing. 

Also, I measured the circumference of my head and used the â€œsize chartâ€ and the fit is so close that I barely 
barely had to use the ratchet adjustment. 

Iâ€™m a mountain biker and this helmet works great. No movement of the helmet over rough ground or rocks. Itâ€™s just part of the head going for a ride.
review.name: Incredible helmet !!

review.reviewBody: This helmet fell off my bike from 3 ft up and cracked right down the middle they didn't even have the decency to replace it even though that's clearly a defect they say they are committed to quality and high performance my skull probably would have cracked if I had fallen with that on head first
review.name: Defective and unsafe

review.reviewBody: I canâ€™t remember the last time i wore a helmet. However my husband wears a helmet on almost every ride. When i started joining him frequently on rides during covid he asked if I wanted a helmet, and i declined. Since then a few times i have mentioned that he has a helmet and i am bareheaded and he needed to take it easy. This summer on one of our first rides my husband handed me a smith convoy helmet in merlot. He told me to either wear it or stop fussing about him wearing one. I was not excited but put it on. I was in awe at how well it fit and felt. Not heavy but comfortable and secure. On the first ride it did not move about on my head or i interfere with my sun glasses. After 20 miles i was sold. I am looking forward to many more rides with this helmet
review.name: Best helmet

review.reviewBody: Little tight, hope stretch a little, so fan Iâ€™m happy
review.name: Excellent quality

review.reviewBody: I was riding on a jump line (yes. Should have had a full face) I whacked my head so hard (got whiplash and heavily winded) but no concussion. Impressed and will buy another
review.name: Did itâ€™s job!

review.reviewBody: Its perfect for my big-headed, trail-loving kindergartner. Light weight and stays in place! Glad to have the fit guide available online-it was spot on.
review.name: Great, light helmet.

review.reviewBody:
I bought the L-sized Convoy at a LBS knowing that my old helmet would have to be replaced soon due to age. I found that it fit my round-shaped head well without too much pinching. I continued to use it throughout the year and found it provided decent protection from the elements (exposure, rain, dirt) and good ventilation. The helmet really saved my life when I was riding home from work on an unusual patch of road where I had a really bad over-the-bars crash. The visor snapped off, predictably, and the shell did its job of absorbing the impact forces. I walked away with no immediate symptoms of concussion. 

I would have never thought the Smith Convoy was such a heavy-hitter while maintaining a stylish yet lightweight profile. Thanks for saving my head.
review.name: Life-saving helmet with excellent fit and harness/strap adjustability

name: Convoy Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody: Great comfortable and robust hiking shoe. Very satisfied with this purchase.
review.name: Merrell Moab 3

review.reviewBody: Solid sneaker for light trails. Prefer the boot hieght.
review.name: Solid

review.reviewBody:
Tip top shoes, extremely well made. Very comfortable.
Merrills for the win!! 5 stars
review.name: Moab3's

review.reviewBody: I've worn the Moab mid-rise for years and this pair is consistent with all my previous pairs, but offers a nice alternative for hikes where the added ankle protection isn't needed or desired. All in all a great shoe for local hikes and work with uneven or unpredictable ground. Thanks for keeping a good design going and not messing with it.
review.name: My go-to hiking shoe

review.reviewBody: As a middle aged/old tradie, I find I can wear these all day without my feet aching at the end of the day. Theyâ€™re supportive and very comfortable. Oh and being water resistant on the job site is really handy.
review.name: Tradie comfort

review.reviewBody: Not qualified to rate just had one short hike and they were fine,
review.name: Break in

review.reviewBody: I've been wearing the Moabs for several years now.  I was very disappointed in the Moab 3. There was little to no cushion to the insoles. These had been the most comfortable shoes ever, but now I might just start looking for a different brand.
review.name: Hard insoles
comment: We are sorry to hear these did not work out for you. If we can help please give us a call at 800-288-3124.

review.reviewBody: Itâ€™s hard for me to find shoes that fit. The shoes fit well and they have excellent traction so they donâ€™t slip a lot. The only reason I didnâ€™t give them a five star rating is because they donâ€™t exactly match the color shown on the product page on the website. I was expecting them to be more of a natural leather color.  I kept them anyway
review.name: Great Fit

review.reviewBody: QUALITY comes at a price and this product is quality so if you can get them on Special they are a good buy.
review.name: QUALITY.

review.reviewBody: Nice and light shoe for summer walking. The sole design seems quite good. Lightweight top material keeps the weight down. Slightly limited sizes available so I ended up with a half size larger than I usually take. The shoes are wider than my usual Scarpa walking shoes. The shop I went to didnâ€™t have my preferred size and colour combination in stock but arranged delivery from another state. The shoes turned up the next day which is almost unheard of. Well done Hobart Merrell shop.
review.name: Lightweight walking shoe

name: Moab 3 Hiking Shoe - Men's

hasVariant.name: Essential Trail Kit
hasVariant.description: Buy the Primus Essential Trail Kit online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
This is perfect for day hikes and accents, as well as longer solo trips. Its ability to be packed away efficiently and conveniently into a self-contained unit is a huge plus. If you're looking for a lightweight, minimal kitchen set up I would recommend this trail kit. It is roughly the same size as a Jetboil when packed up, and while its a bit slower to boil water (~ 1.5 minutes longer) the difference in price makes this Primus product more than worth it. 

This product was designed well. The ceramic coating on the inside of the fry pan works well and the quality of the manufacturing of the pot/pan feels high. There is even a spout on the lip of the pot that makes pouring easy and makes draining the food you're cooking easier and safer. Its also a breeze to clean. The handles for the pot/pan can be used to "latch" the setup closed, as opposed to relying on the mesh bag to keep the fry pan in place as a lid. Primus really thought of it all - there aren't any additional features this setup is missing. Really can't recommend this product enough.
review.name: Thoughtfully Designed

name: Essential Trail Kit

review.reviewBody: The womenâ€™s sizing is off. I took measurements for my wife before buying, and she was on the cusp between S and XS. I went with small and itâ€™s huge on her. Not even close really. A shame because the menâ€™s sizing was correct. Iâ€™m sure if it had fit, my review would be higher; at least 4 stars.
review.name: Potentially nice, butâ€¦

review.reviewBody: Turned out to be more than I needed for my activity
review.name: Turned out to be more

review.reviewBody:
I was looking for a pair of down pants to easily throw on as an additional layer for the morning and evening dog walks in WI winters. 
The bibs are warm, and the olive green color is fun and looks the same in person from what it shows online. Size Small fit is good- Iâ€™m 5â€™ 6â€, 130lb and have a long torso. 

In the super windy & below zero temps, I could feel the wind through a little bit, so Iâ€™ve thrown a windproof layer over (like a rain pant) to have the ultimate weather protection. 
The elastic straps are plenty stretchy, but would love a style where the straps can be unfastened to make it a little easier to get in to these instead of unzipping the one side and climbing in from there. 

Overall, these are a great addition to my winter wardrobe and on par with what I expected.
review.name: Good addition

review.reviewBody: I love this for taking the dog outside in the winter. So warm even without a base layer and I love having three pockets. Not sure why there is a whole leg zipper but there you go. They are easy to slip on like snow pants and the straps go on fine even though they donâ€™t unhook. They do get warm if youâ€™re moving around so I like them more for hanging out and staying warm. Iâ€™m 5â€™8â€ and ~175 and the large has plenty of room for layering.
review.name: A down jacket for your legs

review.reviewBody: I was worried a pair of down pants would look like a big diaper, but these overalls were cute, cozy and I pretty much wore them non-stop during a recent trip to Alaska. I can't wait to put these on under my ski bib this winter. Easy to get in and out of, great pockets. No regrets!
review.name: Cozy, warm and addictive

review.reviewBody: My overalls were too large; when I searched for an XS, you were out of stock. I would like to exchange for an XS when you get stock.
review.name: Down Overall

review.reviewBody: Ran way too large. Also, thereâ€™s no snaps on the straps so theyâ€™re not easy to put on.
review.name: Down smowpants

review.reviewBody: This is a Christmas gift for our daughter so she has mot opened it yet. Don't know how long your survey will be open.
review.name: This is a Christmas gift

review.reviewBody: Super cute overall but they run big and difficult to alter due to great zipper feature at ankle.
review.name: Fuego down overall

review.reviewBody: I got these to replace a pair of down pants from another brand. They fit nicely and give me some extra room. They are warm. The side zipper easy is very functional.
review.name: Great fit and warmth

name: Fuego Down Overall - Women's

review.reviewBody:
This jersey makes me feel a bit like an alpaca. 

Not going to lie, as a top layer I feel a bit goofy walking around in the material, I don't own too much that similar to this so it's an adjustment, but honestly, this jersey shines as a midlayer when paired with a windbreaker jacket. 

I've been using this under the Summit 3L WXB jacket in temps as low as 25-30 and it's been amazing, honestly almost too warm with how warm I run. Excited to test this out during some sub zero night fat biking! 

It's mega breathable and wicks moisture like nobodies business. Its also nice to have the pockets on the back just in case my windbreaker layer gets a bit warm and I need to shed some heat. 

This piece won an award from polartec for it's ability to shed moisture and body heat for a reason! 

fits true to size, but fits like it's meant to be layered over top of, so slightly slim.
review.name: Embrace your inner Alpaca

name: Pro Alpha Layer - Men's

review.reviewBody: Normally wear a size 15, however, Tevas have always run big. Not anymore. Ordered size 14 and was too small. Plus, Teva must have changed the glue in recent years because all my Tevas are separating. No longer durable in water - wearing them as lake shoes only accelerates the decomposition process. Too bad - used to love Tevas.
review.name: Teva changed sizing + Quality isn't same

review.reviewBody: I have used this sandal for several sandals almost constantly during the warm and hot months of the Texas coast. It is ruggedly built and protects my feet from most scrapes. It is comfortable from the beginning. I also readily wade through water with it, and it dries quickly. I get no blisters or rubbing. I have just about worn out the tread on my current pair, so I have bought an identical set for replacement when my current pair finally give up the ghost.
review.name: Solid sandal for land and water

review.reviewBody: The headline says it all. The heel support strap pulled out of the sole.
review.name: Lasted less than 6 months.

review.reviewBody: I've owned 2 pairs of Teva's since I started wearing sandles 30 years ago. I've tried the Terra Fi 5 around the house. I just can't get confortable with them. There's an arch support now that I can't quite line up with my feet. The triangle on the inside of the ankles isn't comfortable and it looks like the will wear through quickly. I like to keep my sandles loose on the top but tight front to back to keep my feet from overheating. I can't seem to do that with these and have to keep tight on all sides because there's no clip to hold the settings...so my feet are overheating. I might have to return and go with a different brand.
review.name: Not as good as the Toachi 2

review.reviewBody: Great hiking sandal that MORE than lives up to the hype!
review.name: Great Hiking Sandal

review.reviewBody: I needed a Women's size 9, which was not available, so I ordered a Men's size 7, which works perfectly. This is one of the few sandals I can wear, since I have multiple problems with my feet
review.name: Great shoes

review.reviewBody: My dad was originally super stoked to have these sandals. They fit well, have great arch support and we're overall very comfortable. He's worn them a handful of times last August and this July and one of the straps came out of the sole. These are not fit for moderate use. What's CRAZY is that he still has his tevas from the 90s!!! Wears them every year!! These new ones lasted 13 months and a total of 2 months use. I wish I could attach a photo :(
review.name: Really comfortable but defective

review.reviewBody: Since I live in Sweden, we can wear sandals for about 4-5 months per year. This means it took about 18-20 months for the sandals to break. At the beginning of the summer, they started developing small holes in the sole. But now, as summer comes to an end, you can see through the sandal. The quality of the sole is extremely poor, as it took less than two years to break down. I can no longer recommend these sandals. They are comfortable, but they wear out far too easily. My last ones lasted for 9 years, and those years was I very active.
review.name: Ain't what it used to be.

review.reviewBody: Hi there, I have been wearing year round Terra Fi sandals for years now. It is practically the only shoewear I wear. I was so disappointed to see that it is not available in size 16 mens anymore? What are the chances that you will bring that back please? TIA
review.name: Crazy about this sandal but...

review.reviewBody: Like this much better than the hurricane! Very comfortable and does not dig into my feet!
review.name: Definitely my favorite sandal

name: Terra Fi 5 Universal Sandal - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Vario Speed Harness online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I use it either for my 10 year old daughter or for my adult clients! 

Really good for courses and top rope easy climbs!
review.name: Grate versatility!

review.reviewBody: Bought this as a back up harness and for when I bring the friend that doesn't have gear. Great basic harness packs really small.
review.name: Perfect for the friends

review.reviewBody: Easy to adjust to fit a broad size of climbers, when repelling the straps can be a bit uncomfortable due to the narrow width of the waste bands and leg bands.
review.name: Excellent Product

review.reviewBody: We just purchased a bunch of new gear for our outdoor adventure summer camp, Missoula Outdoor Learning Adventures, including stoppers, cams, rope, ATC's, locking biners, harnesses, etc. As owner of the camp, BD is the clear choice for me when I'm putting other people's children (and my own!) on the rock. We've been using BD gear for 20+ years, I've never been disappointed, and I always feel confident sending groups out to climb. With excellent attention to details of safety and functionality, BD earns a 5 star rating from me.
review.name: Obvious Choices for Novice and Pros

review.reviewBody: I bought 4 of these for my scout troop to use when climbing and rappelling. They would be better with some gear loops, but for the price I am completely satisfied.
review.name: Great price for my Scout program

review.reviewBody: Very good simple harness which has self locking buckles which, importantly, are easy to adjust to the correct tightness.  One size fits virtually everyone apart from the super fat and they probably wouldn't be able to climb any way.  A gear loop would have been useful.
review.name: Ideal for climbing schools and Guides

name: Vario Speed Harness

review.reviewBody: Love these pants. Second purchase and pleased with the quality and comfort
review.name: Comfortable wearing pants

review.reviewBody: These were a GREAT buy! SUPER comfy, stylish, and flexible. Love the feel of the material, these seem like they'll be great daily drivers for all manner of activities
review.name: RUN, don't walk. Buy multiples!

review.reviewBody: These are the second pair of pants I've purchased, and I'm thrilled once again. The fit is perfect, they are very comfortable, and the material is top-notch-super durable and perfect for any weather. I highly recommend them; they're an excellent investment and absolutely worth it!
review.name: My Second Pair - Still Perfect for Any Occasion!

review.reviewBody: Fits perfectly. I love that I can wear these for hiking on a cold day or just out casually. The material breathes well to keep me cool on a hot day and warm on a cold day. Would definitely buy more
review.name: Great pair of pants for any occasion

review.reviewBody: Comfortable solid fit may be a little too loose on me but otherwise very good pants.
review.name: All good

review.reviewBody: Fits true to size at the waist. The material breathes while not making me feel too hot on a warm day, and keeping me warm on a cold day if that makes sense. Plenty of pockets to hold your wallet, phone, and keys. Would definitely buy again. These are my second pair of sprag pants.
review.name: Great pair of pants for any occasion

review.reviewBody: Great fit. Love the color. Great for work and hiking.
review.name: Awesome Pants

review.reviewBody: Bought every color because of the comfort. Loved the paramount pants but these pants take the wheel. They have that light tactical feel. Perfect for a hike, light or durable work attire, comfortable under waders, great for layering. They cut wind a little better than the paramount pants too.
review.name: Sprang > Paramount

review.reviewBody: I enjoy these pants. They have been my go to for work and the weekend. They would be 5 stars if they kept the same design as last year. I liked the pocket design and last year's model fit just a bit more snug in the waist, but overall a great pant. I am 6'5" and enjoy the long size offered in these pants.
review.name: Good pants for tall guys.

review.reviewBody: These five-pocket Sprag pants are by far the most useful in my entire wardrobe and a perennial staple. The cut is great for my body (6' 1.5", 225 lbs athletic muscular build), but the are also easy to tailor if needed. I have worn these on backpacking trips, to the office, skiing, and after a long day have fallen asleep in them.
review.name: Worth it

name: Sprag 5-Pocket Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: I struggle finding tops that works for me because of my build, I am thick chested and have a bigger belly than I would like.  (it is why I took up paddling, to get fit.)  As I am trying to get on the water as much as possible, it is inevitable that I get rained on.  So I tried using a normal rain jacket and it was SO tight around my shoulders and chest that it was about impossible to paddle in.  So I tried the ?Endurance Jacket? and was very pleased.  I had lots of room and it did not impede my paddling at all. Love the new high visibility ?Salsa? color as well.  Great product.
review.name: Easier to paddle in than my rain jacket.

review.reviewBody: Just received this pair of boots and seriously on the fence about sending them back. They are weirdly adorable, seem remarkably warm and well made, and are shockingly light weight (for comparison, my kiddo has been in Bogs Neo Classic the past few winters). The photos do not do justice to how huge the feet of these boots are in person. Ordered size 30/31 and they look like they could fit an adult foot comfortably, but are snug to my kid's foot and would be true to size. The bulk may be justified for the insulation gained, but I have serious concerns about sending my kid to navigate the stairs and playground at school. Not sure it's worth the gamble for her teeth. The snow collar does not even come close to cinching to her calves.
review.name: Ginormous feet

name: Niseko 3.0 Boot - Kids'

review.reviewBody: Durable, breathable, machine washable, UPF protection.
review.name: Best hat ever

review.reviewBody:
I love this cap, they are the only ones I wear!
It fits my head without any wrinkling or bunching up in the back, not to mention it's super lightweight, form fitting, and when you get caught in the rain it dries super quick.
My only gripe? You need one in a brown color. I have eleven swift caps all told and only one comes close to a brown color, it's more a coral, which is now getting worn and frayed, but that one is not offered any more.
review.name: Super light weight and form fitting!

review.reviewBody: I lost my orange color swift cap, on a kayak creek adventure, will orange be available again?   Recently ordered a hunter green one, but orange is my happy color and great for safety visuality.
review.name: I miss the orange color hat.

review.reviewBody: I have worn this hat for years and loved it! It fit perfectly, was very comfortable and lightweight, and had a respectable amount of shade from the bill. But it was wearing out, so I bought a new one, in the "one size" version, as that was all that was available. But the new one is too big for my head-size hat. I cinched it up, but there's a big pooch out at the back. Plus, the hat now comes down far enough to interfere with my sunglasses. A disappointment! Heads vary in size! Hats should, too!
review.name: Great hat for running, but needs more sizes

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love this cap! It's so lightweight and breathable that you forget it's there!
review.name: Best sports cap I own

review.reviewBody: Love the Swift Cap.  Light, cool, great shade!  We have several!
review.name: Love the Swift Caps

review.reviewBody: This is a great hat with high visibility color to wear while hiking during hunting season.  Fits good too.
review.name: Great hat with high visibility color

review.reviewBody: My favourite hat in the sun, rain or snow. My Swiftcap always fit just right. I like how light it is.
review.name: Great hat for all seasons.

review.reviewBody: I have three of these now. Theyâ€™re very lightweight and airy.
review.name: Great hats

review.reviewBody: Was adjusting the size and the clip on the back of hat broke?
review.name: Clip on back of hat broke?

Buy the KEEN Circadia Polar Mid Hiking Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Circadia Polar Mid Hiking Boot - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the KEEN Circadia Polar Mid Hiking Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Circadia Polar Mid Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Finally, a shoe for my duck feet! I have had a few other Keens (Elsa, Elena, Gretta and Steen), but none of them were quite this wedge shape! These boots feel like they were made for me! I have a wide foot and these have a nice roomy toe box. Much roomier than the other Keen styles I have tried. I think the length is true to size.
I noticed a few reviews stating these boots were hard to put on, and I found that to be true the first few times, but they loosened up. They have a gusset that goes all the way up to the ankle, so if you have a higher insep, putting them on could be an issue for you. I put them to the test and they are waterproof! I walked around in a muskeg for about an hour and my feet stayed nice and dry!
My feet are always cold, so I really like the insulated version (I have the non insulated ones as well). It has not been super cold here yet, but they have been keeping my feet warm so far. 
Please don't stop making these Keen! I finally found my shoe!
review.name: Keen, please don't stop making these!

review.itemreviewed: Circadia Polar Mid Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased these boots to replace another pair of Keen boots that I wore out. These are a little lighter weight than the Kaci's I previously had, but I was looking for a lighter-duty boot because I tend to wind up using them year-round. I mostly walk on paved roads but love having good boots in my arsenal for hitting the trail with my dog. I did pop in a pair of Superfeet insoles and removed the keen insoles. But then I added the keen insoles to a pair of Chelsea boots and made them extra comfy. I can feel where the shoe transitions above my toes, but I am hopeful that this will decrease as they wear in.

I hope these will last me several years. I am trying not to wear them every day because they're so lovely for my wet and chilly Pacific Northwest dog walking adventures.
review.name: Toasty toes for years to come

review.itemreviewed: Circadia Polar Mid Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bought these after Keen stopped making the old lighter weight Kaci's. Wanted to like them, kept trying to break them in multiple times. They are the most uncomfortable boots I've ever bought, truly unwearable. Gave up eventually and donated them to the thrift store! Used to wear Keen almost exclusively for years, they changed them all, can't find any that are comfortable anymore. And why are all the women's colors pastel. . . I would buy the men's versions, better colors and styles still look like old Keens, if they made small enough sizes.
review.name: Unwearable, donated to thrift store.

review.itemreviewed: Circadia Polar Mid Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I live high in the CO mountains & my other boots are taller with ice cleats on them. They are tough to remove so Iâ€™m happy with my new Womenâ€™s Circadian height for casual wear.
review.name: High enough for going into stores with snow without being clunky sounding. I live high in the

review.itemreviewed: Circadia Polar Mid Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These shoes were stiff at 1st but after a few wearings they are becoming more comfortable. I have always liked Keen shoes. I did add an arch support under the insole. Love the color too.
review.name: Nice shoe boot

review.itemreviewed: Circadia Polar Mid Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bought these for my girl as Christmas gift, she loves them and what the company does for deforestation.
review.name: Gift

review.itemreviewed: Circadia Polar Mid Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The boots definitely have kept me warm in the snow but a strap on both boots ripped within the first week of wearing them.
review.name: Warm but be careful with straps

review.itemreviewed: Circadia Polar Mid Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I could not get my foot into the boot. I have very high arches and the opening of the boot is not big enough for my foot to fit through. Very disappointed.
review.name: Opening too small

review.itemreviewed: Circadia Polar Mid Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Comfy boot, I feel stable and safe in this light weight boot. I love these boots, great for hiking.
review.name: Comfy boot, I feel stable

review.itemreviewed: Circadia Polar Mid Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Its seems like I always have cold feet - fall, winter, spring. I love the mid-high ankle support for just a few inches of snow! Keen shoes always fit my feet. I can put on s new pair and wear them all day, even if I'm going on a hike. They are also reliably well made and will literally last for years. I now have a closet full of Keen footwear for any season or need - dressy sandals to utilitarian every day wear to hiking on the wettest and/or muddiest trails.
review.name: Three season comfort!

name: Circadia Polar Mid Hiking Boot - Women's

description: Buy the Giro Peloton Cap online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Peloton Cap
hasVariant.description: Buy the Giro Peloton Cap online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I didn't have high expectations for this cap. But, I was pleasantly surprised once it was snuggly on my bald head. I wear something under my helmet almost every ride to prevent "grill marks". My goto was my Castelli summer cap or summer band. The Giro feels like it is a part of my Giro Syntax helmet. It is not to big or bulky. It has a perfectly-sized brim, breathes, and is soft to the touch. I'm considering a 2nd or 3rd. 
Update: After a few sessions on my indoor trainer,  I'll add absorbs sweat like a sponge.
review.name: My Castelli Skullcap May Have Comp!

review.reviewBody:
I'm a sweater, and due to some pasty skin I also could get a sunburn from a night-light.  Having short hair i'm always concerned about getting the top of my head burnt so I've tried everything from baseball caps to bandanas on my head while i ride.

The thin fabric fits great under my road helmet and is very breathable. It doesn't have the heaviest sweat band but this works in it's favor as it makes it very comfortable to wear. I wore it on a 60 degree day and my head was actually cold.

I have used it for running and cycling works great for both.

It is hand-wash only.

I would definitely recommend.
review.name: A great hat for the value

name: Peloton Cap

review.reviewBody: Bought a second pair because I love the first so much.  Great for indoor and outdoor climbing even in warm weather because the fabric is rather light. Pockets are amazing.  Have not experienced  excessive pilling, but I only use for climbing.
review.name: Perfect for climbing

review.reviewBody: Love the fit and style of these capris. They are tailored without being tight, made of a super soft fabric that I am hoping will wear well and not be prone to pilling. Time will tell! The waist is super comfortable and the length is just right. Colors are great too.
review.name: best hiking capris ever!

review.reviewBody: Great fit, capris length is perfect, and runs true to size, purchased a Small. For reference I'm 5'1" 129#. I wish these came in more colors.
review.name: Would buy in different colors

review.reviewBody: Love these! This is my second pair. They are so comfortable and fast drying.
review.name: I would buy them again and again.

review.reviewBody: These capris are SO comfortable! I purchased 2 pairs and are waiting for the navy to come back in stock so I can have color options â¤ï¸
review.name: LOVE these capris!!

review.reviewBody: After only one wear, I noticed them pilling on the backside. Another reviewer mentioned it prior to my purchase and I hoped it was a one off. Nope! I, too, expected better quality from North Face... I can only wear them around the house since having butt pilling in public is not my thing.
review.name: Fabric Pills Easily

review.reviewBody: Love them! Fit great. Will definitely buy in other colors!
review.name: Love them

review.reviewBody: Most comfortable pants that I own. Light and airy. Stretchy. Will be buying another pair.

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable, fit is accurate to The North Face's sizing chart. Wish they would restock my size soon.
review.name: I would buy this product again.

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love these capris! They are comfortable, stylish and lightweight. I would like to see additional colors--olive green would be great!
review.name: I will purchase these again.

review.reviewBody: Bought for hiking and backpacking. Worn w. thin polyester socks. Comfortable, w. excellent soles. But the slip-on construction meant, in my case, that the shoe tended to slip around the long axis of my foot when I was walking across steep slopesâ€”a liability. I am elsewhere a size 12; bought size 13. A smaller size would have jammed my toes. Like that shoe is vegan and shed water beautifully.
review.name: Norda 003 Sleek & Slippy.

review.reviewBody:
I liked this shoes right up until I got them on. I wear a 12 shoe/ boot and a 12 in this brand was a  half size to small and a pistol, to get on. My toe was up against the front of the toe box. Seems from my search that they go from a 12 straight to a 13 with no half size between. With a shoe costing almost 300 bucks US , the manufacture could have done better on their sizing of this  product. 
Sent them back
review.name: Norda 003 men shoe.  DISAPPOINTED

name: 003 Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: I was hoping these cycling shorts were going to great, but I was actually disappointed in the comfort and the material.  Broke them in on a short 21 mile ride and they are definitely my 3rd favorite pair of shorts behind my Assos Mile GT C2 and Rapha Cargo shorts.
review.name: Was hoping they were going to be awesoâ€¦

review.reviewBody: I have been riding in these shorts for a few months, and am very pleased with the performance of the chamois and the other materials in these shorts. They feel invisible when I ride, allowing full range of motion without resistance and never shifting out of place no matter how hard I'm going at it. They are designed to be skin-fit so an apparent smallness is to be expected, but I am at the very bottom of the size range for XS and I still found them tight to pull on the first few times. They have broken in a bit with use and now go on easier while still offering the very high performance fit. Now it feels like they've adapted to my body and become a perfect second skin that provides great cushioning while I ride. I use them on their own, and also under softshell pants in colder conditions. In both situations, they feel great and perform very well! I also really appreciate the clean finish on the rear of the shorts, which makes the aesthetic more refined and saves me from striding around the grocery store while people double take at my padded butt.
review.name: Excellent, skin fit chamois short

name: MK3 Short - Men's

review.reviewBody:
This review is not about the jacket, it's about the one I received. The first time I wore it, feathers started coming out from a small hole. And BackCountry refused to replace it for me.

As a matter of fact, there were two items in my order, and both were defective. They had to replace the other item, because no way they can blame me for that one.

I'm so disappointed by the quality control by BackCountry.
review.name: Poor quality control

review.reviewBody: I have owned a Patagonia hooded nano puff (NOT this product) for about 10 years and that thing has been through the wringer. It was my first Patagonia product and has gotten me hooked on the brand. I got the down sweater (this product) for my birthday this year. So far I have warn it on dog walks (coldest was 6 degrees), hikes, and around town and it has done the job. It arrived with a tiny hole, but Backcountry quickly replaced the whole jacket for free. This thing is a lot warmer than my aging nano puff, but still remains very light weight. This down jacket is also more durable than a lot of the competition which I like, especially at this price point. The last thing you want is to get a tear in your favorite down jacket less than a year in from a tiny snag. I love the pockets and hood design. Would recommend!
review.name: A Classic

review.reviewBody:
My lifestyle is more Urban Explorer than hard-core hiker, but I have spent my fair share of days traipsing about Bavaria & the Scottish Highlands.  I have generally had good luck with Patagonia and have always liked their products with just a couple of exceptions.  

The Good & the Not So Good- I have a Down Sweater Vest that is incredible.  It warm, the fit is great and it has held up well over the past 2-3 years of regular use.  I've found it to be quite versatile worn over a lighter mid-layer or when used as a mid layer under a shell/jacket for extra warmth.   I've also owned two Patagonia Nanopuff Jackets, both treated virtually equally.  One has been brilliant, the other began losing the threading between the baffles within 6 months.

I recently ordered a new Patagonia Down Sweater Jacket and as soon as it was removed from packaging, noticed it was shedding down in several places- Not large bits, just a number of small puffs.  This concerned me enough that I returned it and purchased a RAB Down Jacket instead, another brand I've had great luck with.

Perhaps the Down Sweater jacket I received was just a one-ff, but I have noticed other reviews mentioning the same issue.  I will still consider Patagonia gear in the future, but I'll likely stick with RAB for any down products.  I'll leave a review of that coat once I've used it for a bit.
review.name: WANTED TO LOVE IT, BUT...

review.reviewBody:
This jacket is super light and super warm. It also repels light amount of moisture and rain. 

A few annoying things about it, though.

1.) the hood can't be removed or put on when the jacket is fully zipped...its too tight to squeeze on or off without zipping your jacket down a bit

2.) this thing sheds feathers like no other down jacket i've owned. have not really put it through its paces yet so to see it losing feathers with casual, commuter use is not ideal.
review.name: Warm and comfy; loses feathers fast

review.reviewBody: I bought a Patagonia coat that was supposed to be black but Back Country sent a blue coat. Then sending it back and getting a refund was horrible and difficult. Took nearly a month to get my refund. I posted this story on social media
review.name: Worst customer service

review.reviewBody: I bought the down jacket while Backcountry was running an amazing sale event.  I have done extensive research of the down jacket and the deal was too great to pass away.  Even though it's around April, I was able to use the down jacket during my teens outdoor soccer games (30's degree w/ strong wind).  The jacket just kept me very warm and windproof (the hoodie is amazingly).
review.name: Great value and quality

review.reviewBody: Very warm. I buy a size bigger to wear a hoodie under and Iâ€™m always comfortable during New England winters. My beef is like most gear Iâ€™ve owned back in my the day, the quality of the new stuff seems to have gone by the wayside. I own a few Patagonia jackets and my older ones are still looking good. New ones are 100$ more in just the last couple years. I feel the new jackets tear easily. Caught a thorn on the arm and it shredded the jacket, my old jacket doesnâ€™t have a tear on it after years of wear. The issue I notice the most is the feathers seem to come out of ever seam they can fin. The jacket I recently got has feathers coming out all over it. My old Patagonia, not a feather to been lost, sigh, I know I sound like an old man yelling at clouds but they just donâ€™t make them like they used to. Still a nice warm jacket with a pretty ethical company so you make the call
review.name: Patagonia down hoodie

review.reviewBody: I love my Patagonia Down Sweater Hooded Jacket. However, if you're allergic to down feathers, the jacket might be challenge when it gets moist out.
review.name: Warm and Cozy

review.reviewBody: I ordered size Medium, as I wear in my other Patagonia fleeces and jackets. The body and arms fit well as expected. The jacket is warm, soft, and light, and a joy to wear. However, the hood when fully zipped is so tight that it digs into my chin and restricts my head movement. In other words, with the zipper in the fully up position the bottom of the face opening is on my chin and tight against it. Even if I pull it down below my chin it's still tight, digging in beneath my mouth. There is a cinch cord in the back. It comes fully extended when new, but just to make sure I wasn't mis-using it I cinched it tight. Yep, it was even tighter. This is really a mystery to me how the hood was designed. Unfortunately I had to return this jacket because I would never be able to use the hood fully zipped and then - what is the point of having a hooded jacket.
review.name: Nice Jacket But Hood Too Tight to Use

review.reviewBody: I purchased this jacket for my boyfriend because he had the same one (different color)  before and liked it. After wearing it for a couple of weeks, he noticed some down feathers coming out of a small hole. He is very careful with his clothes, and did not cause the problem.
review.name: Okay, but flawed

Patagonia Menâ€™s Down Sweater Hooded Jacket | GH Review

review.reviewBody: This duffel is quite sturdy and was the exact gear that got the job done; thank you, North Face! Made beautifully!
review.name: Greenlight!

review.reviewBody: 2 trips so far. Perfect for my needs. Use in conjunction with North Face Base Camp Rolling Thunder, carry-on 22".
review.name: Base Camp Voyager Duffel-62L

review.reviewBody: I love this bag! It's been great for weekend trips and short stays. Such a great purchase.
review.name: I would recommend this product to friends.

review.reviewBody: Perfect duffle for week trips and works as a carry on! Fit so much in the main compartment and the side pockets are perfect for shoes!
review.name: Best carry on duffle

review.reviewBody: The perfect travel back for a weekender or longer. Great quality and love the color and utility
review.name: North face makes the best bags

review.reviewBody: Capacity is not accurately advertised and the quality is quite poor for the price. Really disappointing.
review.name: Overpriced

review.reviewBody: Bought this bag to travel through Europe fall â€˜24. It holds a lot of items, and zips up with stitched-in quality zippers. I did have a tiny stitching flaw that I had to cut (2â€ string) after a week of use, but it did not appear to affect anything with the bag closure or secureness while continuing on my endeavors. I think it was added string that worked its way loose. Backpack straps are comfortable and pretty adjustable as another bag from NF. I packed this bag 100% full and still was able to squeeze it in to aircraft overhead bins, which was a very big concern of mine. I love the extra shoe storage pocket and other small pockets that make this bag a real world traveler duffle style winner!! I would by this bag again for sure.
review.name: As expected from North Face

review.reviewBody: It is everything I was expecting and has all the features you could want for a bag like this. The stitching is sturdy, the zippers are strong and slide well, the compartments allow for breaking up your gear into distinct sections to keep shoes from getting clothes dirty and separating clothes with the moveable vertical partition. I am very excited to use this for upcoming holiday travel as it will fit everything I need to bring with room to spare! If I had to pick one thing to complain about, it would be nice to have an extra partition for the main part of the bag but such a minor thing.
review.name: Just buy it unless you want a smaller size, it's great!

review.reviewBody: The Base Camp Voyager Duffel-62L is a durable and versatile travel bag, perfect for extended trips. Its lightweight design and rugged construction make it ideal for both outdoor adventures and general travel. The large 62L capacity offers ample space for gear, while the multiple compartments help with organization. It features comfortable straps for easy carrying as a backpack or duffel. A great choice if you're looking for a tough, spacious, and adaptable travel companion
review.name: Base Camp Voyager Duffel-62L: Durable, Spacious, and Travel

review.reviewBody: Super roomy bag that also folds up nicely for a small footprint in the apartment.
review.name: Gets the job done well

name: Base Camp Voyager 62L Duffel Bag

hasVariant.name: Distance Tent: 2-Person 3-Season + Adapter
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Distance Tent: 2-Person 3-Season + Adapter online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Very light and easy to set up. Stoked
review.name: Very light and easy to

review.reviewBody:
I love how simple and lightweight the tent is. I have back problems, so I can't take too much weight in my pack. This was perfect for that! 
Both mornings, though, I woke up to outrageous amounts of condensation inside the tent. The second night, I left the main air flap of the door open, and still there was water everywhere.
review.name: Great Concept! But...water.

review.reviewBody: I think this is the best tent on the market that uses trekking poles. Itâ€™s not the lightest, but the design more than makes up for it. It has a very easy setup, is quite sturdy in the wind, and quite spacious, all attributes not commonly found in a trekking pole tent. 100% would recommend (and do) and buy again.
review.name: Best Trekking Pole Tent

review.reviewBody: I really love the packability of this single wall tent. It condenses more than I like, but it is surprisingly sturdy in storm force gales. I recently put it to the test in a storm in Greenland. I was nearly certain the weather would rip it to shreds, but by morning everything was in place, nothing was damaged, and I stayed warm and dry.
review.name: Mr.

review.reviewBody: I have tried using this tent multiple times. Once when it was raining out and once when it was dry. The inside gets soaking wet in both situations. The morning dew completely gets inside or the condensation from your warmth. Your stuff and yourself will end up soaked. I hate this tent and I spent so much money on it.
review.name: Gets so wet

review.reviewBody: Very good as a bivouac tent. Ingenious and minimalist design. Super light. We sleep two people, comfortably. The only thing I would add is the possibility of closing the ventilation, with Velcro or something like that. To prevent dirt (or snow) from entering when the wind blows
review.name: Nice bivi tent

review.reviewBody: Light weight tent using trekking poles. Larger than a Nalgene bottle, about the size of a lightweight summer sleeping bag. Still am improvement in size and weight than a standard tent
review.name: Light weight tent

review.reviewBody: This tent is super light, has plenty of room for two people, and stays fairly dry when itâ€™s damp out. I highly recommend buying adjustable trekking poles to use with this tent, that way you can get the length just right to keep it taut. Only issue I had with the tent is that when I woke up one of the poles had fallen over. Maybe I didnâ€™t set it in the ground securely enough.
review.name: Awesome tent

review.reviewBody: I have really been enjoying this tent, i have used it on 6 trips some being overnighters and some being 6 and 7 days long and have fallen in love with trekking pole tents. i really enjoy how light weight it is and how it uses poles i already would be packing. i came into this tent suspecting a real bad problem with the condensation and if i had it fully zipped i could see that being an issue but i have treated it more like a spacious bivy instead of a tent. i do recommend if you are going to be using it in high moisture or multi day hikes to use a waterproof sleeping bag cover to prevent your sleeping bag from touching the bottom small foot area of the tent as that was the only time i had any problems with condensation. i also recommend using a tarp or poncho to make a covered area over the door so that you can have the door open when there is high moisture. but with all that being said i have used it in snowy fall conditions, heavy rain and sleeping by a waterfall and know that i can depend on this shelter to keep me dry and out of the wind even without the tarp or sleeping bag cover and just remember to bring something to wipe down the sidewalls before bed just incase
review.name: Lightweight and waterproof

review.reviewBody: I used this tent on a 12-day, 120 mile hike/camping trip at Philmont Scout Ranch.  It was perfect.  Setup and take-down took under five minutes.  It was spacious enough for one person, probably not two.  It handled high winds and rain very well.  The only challenge I experienced was condensation on the inside when the outside temp dropped below the dewpoint.

name: Distance Tent: 2-Person 3-Season + Adapter

review.reviewBody: I bought these to replace a stiffer pair of traditional MTB flat-pedal shoes that hurt one of my feet. These Giro Tracker shoes had been discussed on a social media channel I follow where the cyclist didn't understand why more people weren't using these for gravel-bike riding. The manufacturer describes them almost as a commuter shoe so people didn't seem to take them seriously. I got them on sale and they work great for me, although they are about a half size too large (I'm never quite sure which Euro size to pick so don't blame the shoe). The cyclist I follow online liked the roomier toe box, and so do I. He didn't care for the lack of adjustability in the boa system, and I can understand his point, but they still work fine for me. These were a good buy.
review.name: Low-key cycling shoe that was on sale!

name: Tracker Mountain BIke Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: I received the hat in a reasonable time frame.  The hat itself is well made and attractively designed.  My only disappointment was that the size was too big for me, so I had to make some cardboard fillers to insert inside the inner band to make it fit properly.  I am giving the purchase 5 stars for the product and delivery.  For the Backcountry website, it would be helpful to have some traditional hat sizes associated with the medium, large, etc. sizes.  I am 6 ft 4" and wear XL shirts, so it seemed like the Large I bought should have fit.
review.name: Fiddler Hat purchase

review.reviewBody: It's very comfortable and super cute! My only complaint is that the cut feels too short on the midsection, but otherwise it's a great fleece
review.name: Super cute and comfortable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super warm and cozy pile sweater! I love the cut. The fabric did a good job keeping me dry in light rain as well.
review.name: A new favorite for brisk days!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So first off, I wanted to say that the the fleece is a cropped fit. This was a pleasant surprise for me and my style, but for others it might be different. The size and sleeve length were perfect for me. I got a small and I'm 5'9" with long arms. I didn't size up or down. But do recommend that if you want extra length. Additionally, the color I got (red) is as bright as the photo and the accents are more of a periwinkle imo! It's such a fun contrast. Overall, it's super comfy, warm and practical. I wear it all the time with my cream turtle neck thermal. Although, it's been a warm winter in Minnesota. I can tell it'll be able to keep me warm. :)
review.name: Tomato Girl Winter

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this for my daughter, excellent quality! We all love it!
review.name: excellent quality

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] itâ€™s just at the waist, not too bulky, and nice details.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So comfortable that I ordered another one in a different color, does run large but good for the comfortable oversized fit.
review.name: So comfortable!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this top in pink and was so surprised to find it so soft and cozy. The pockets are excellent too. As soon as I received it in the mail I wore it the whole day and didnâ€™t want to take it off.
review.name: My favorite top

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this fleece so much. I got the purple color and it is a great color. Itâ€™s very cozy and warm and I plan to wear it all fall and winter. I am 5â€™3â€ and 170 pounds and I got the size large. Iâ€™m happy with the size and think it fits great.
review.name: Super cute and cozy fleece!

review.reviewBody: Nice, soft, and warm medium weight fleece. Love the zip kangaroo pockets in the front. Relaxed fit with room for layering underneath. The band at the bottom is fitted.
review.name: Cute and comfy

review.name: Fits great but&.

review.reviewBody: I really tried to make these shoes work.   I would normally wear a size 41 road cycling shoe, I ordered the women's size 41 in white, they were too tight in length. The men's 41 were too large and too wide, the women's size 41.5 and 42 were also long and a bit too wide.   Unfortunately my experience with Giro's sizing is that it is very inconsistent between different models, especially the width between men's and women's shoes.  These sizing issues cost me each time 6.99 in return shipping costs (unlike ordering directly from the brand's website).
review.name: Failed effort

name: Regime Cycling Shoe - Women's
