review.reviewBody: I looove Hokas so much ! I have achilles tendon and Hokas are the only pair of shoes that don't hurt my feet at all! They never disappoint, not sure what happened to this model but it literally triggers my achilles tendon right away not sure why! I returned them immediately. Also they do run small so I would size up. I'm always a size 9 I had to get a 9 1/2 for this particular pair
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody: I loved the Rincon 3 so much but couldn't find them when I wanted another pair. Tried these but they are nothing like what I love about the Rincon 3. I have 3 pairs of the Rincon 3 and am just hoping that they will bring back the 3 before I wear these out, because I will definitely not be buying the 4 again.
review.name: So sad. The previous version was amazing! These are no good

review.reviewBody: I was hoping these would be very similar to my Rincon 3. They've changed so much from the 3. The back of the shoe is different which causes the shoe to rub and cause blisters on my heel. My feet were hurting after the first day and I never had that problem with my Rincon 3s. Hoping they come back with the 3s. I ended up returning these
review.name: Nothing like the Rincon 3

review.reviewBody: This shoe is a big miss. I'm a loyal Hoka owner and always loved their selection of wides and that they truly are wide shoes with ample room in the toe box which is not easy to come by. I LOVED my rincon 3s and they helped me heal my plantar fasciitis and get back on my feet after a calf surgery... but the soles always wore faster than expected. So I was excited to hear that Hoka "fixed" and "improved" the sole with the Rincon 4. I've waiting just under two months to write this review so I could really test out the rincon 4 and here is my take: -the sole is stiffer and firmer in feel BUT still wore out way faster than expected (or it should) The sole is almost shot after almost two months of moderate wear. -narrower and smaller than the previous version. Sized up a half size for the Rincon 4 and the width is still only OK. -not nearly as comfortable is prior version. -the tongue is just awkward and gets in the way when lacing up the shoe. I switched from the Bondi to the Rincon after the Bondi disappointed and now the Rincon disappoints too. It feels like I am starting to detect a theme with Hoka which is too bad because they really are the best wide running shoe provider.
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody: I loved my Rincon 3s. Bought Rincon 4 and it's a totally different shoe and not in a good way! Not as flexible as the 3 and the toe box feels tight as does the fit in general. Why did you change the style? Why are there no non slip patterns on the sole as with the 3? Why did you remove the pull tab to help get the shoe on. Overall I think it's cheaply made. Please go back to Rincon 3 style and features!
review.name: Would NOT buy again!

review.reviewBody: This shoe is not comfortable it hurt my feet so bad. I would return them but I already wore them twice thinking they needed to be broken in, not the case. The shoe seems very short like not enough room in the toe box. I ordered 8 1/2 wide. Not comfortable at all. Very expensive to not be able to wear.
review.name: Not what I expected!

review.reviewBody: I have many pairs of Rincon 3 and the new version runs smaller. Very frustrating!!!! Shoes feels great except need to size up half of a size.
review.name: Made new version smaller

review.reviewBody: I will never buy and thing else but hoka. I've broke both my ankles so I've had a hard time with shoes. And these are amazing
review.name: Yes i wluld

review.reviewBody: These are my everyday shoes and I was so happy when I was able to find them again. Pure comfort.
review.name: I love these shoes

review.reviewBody: I've run in Hokas for three years now, always in the Rincon. (I run 5-7 days a week, usually on the road, and 3-10 miles at a time.) Rincon 3s were maybe my favorite running shoes ever. While my Hokas always cost more and wear out faster than my Brooks, the comfort seemed to make them worth it. As you can imagine, I'm really disappointed to report that the Rincon 4s, which I've run in a total of FOUR times in the past week will be the part pair of Hokas that I will buy. In general, the shoe just feels generally worse with weird design choices. I don't understand the decision to put padding in the tongue and the lacing system seems to have been slightly alerted so that there's now a gap that bunches up on the outside of my foot (NEVER had that issue before). The locker, however, is the bottom of the shoe. The tread is already much smoother and slicker - I can't imagine running on damp asphalt in these - and in just FOUR runs, what little tread there is is already rubbing off to become just smooth, slippery foam. It's ridiculous to pay over $100 for a pair of running shoes and to have them degrade this fast. I'll be lucky if I make them last three months. Honestly there is better quality abs design to be had elsewhere. I read the other reviews complaining that the Rincon 4s aren't great but I trusted in Hokas in general to assume those flaws must be exaggerated. I never write reviews but came in here just to help others avoid this same mistake. The Rincon 4s aren't worth it, even if you get them on sale. I loved Hokas when i first bought them... but now it's time to look elsewhere for a show that's going to make my daily runs with me.
review.name: First time disappointed by a Rincon...

name: Rincon 4 Running Shoe - Women's

description: Buy the Sea To Summit Camp Kitchen Tool Kit - 10-Piece Set online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Camp Kitchen Tool Kit - 10-Piece Set
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Camp Kitchen Tool Kit - 10-Piece Set online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great quality, easy to mix/match depending on backpacking vs car camping. Love it.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice set of tools for camp kitchen. I like the collapsible spoon and spatula best. We put hot sauce, oil, soap in the bottles. Not small but nice organization.
review.name: Good

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It is lightweight and convenient! I've used it trail hiking now several times!
review.name: Great for backpacking!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great containersâ€¦ never leaked. Great for serving up dinner for the backcountry squad. Pair it with the X pot and youâ€™re set!
review.name: Great containersâ€¦ never leaked. Great

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It is an ideal kit to keep kitchen utensils clean, its containers are ideal for carrying both cleaning soaps, oil and seasonings. 
The spatula and spoon are very easy to use. It is a kit that cannot be missing in any camping backpack.
review.name: Comfortable and practical set

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Plastic containers are thick/sturdy and easy to fill up. 
Scrubber is useful and the towels are nice quality.

I hung this item on a tree and was able to just snap the wash towels onto the bottom snaps of the wrap to save room on my clothesline! 
Definitely my favorite part.
review.name: Love the towel clips

review.reviewBody: Honestly I can't think of anything this set is missing. It's nothing fancy, but has all the essentials for cooking and cleanup. I was a little worried about the spatula and spoon at first because they seemed a little delicate, but so far they've held up and it's nice that they collapse for storage. The snap points for hanging up the towels to dry is a thoughtful touch as well.
review.name: Super convenient!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] LOVE this kit. It's all the little pieces you need in your kit, in a handy hanging, foldable case. This is designed more for camping/van life, rather than backpacking, but it sure is handy. The scrubber/wilderness wash combo is ingenious, and the scrubber works really well. The washing cloth is slightly abrasive, and makes cleanup a breeze, and really appreciate the dedicated towel for drying the dishes. The plastic bottles are the best part. Nice and big, (but not too big) and I use the large for oil, and the smaller ones for pancake syrup.
review.name: Everything you need....all in one place.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Being both a winter and high-altitude camper I cook with hot burning liquid stoves. In doing so, I have struggled to find cooking utensils that would hold up to the heat. I have found what I was looking for with this set. Extremely durable, and fairly compact for all that you get with the kit. The kit Itself is not intended for ultra-lite adventures, but when broken down as individual components, the tools are light enough to satisfy those of us who count each gram.
review.name: Great For Hot Stove Cooking

review.reviewBody: I have had several other kitchen lits, but this by far the best..very nice well thought out details great kit
review.name: Great kitchen kit!!

name: Camp Kitchen Tool Kit - 10-Piece Set

review.itemreviewed: Classic High Adjustable Calf Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Used for the first time this past weekend. Very comfortable. May need to experiment with the best type of socks to wear so they come off easily at the end of the day. Very happy with the product and the ability to tighten up the calf as needed.
review.name: Comfortable and dry!

review.itemreviewed: Classic High Adjustable Calf Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Perfect for Zodiac landings in the Arctic. Size ran small for me. Normally 10.5 needed the 11 which fit perfectly.
review.name: Zodiac landing

review.itemreviewed: Classic High Adjustable Calf Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Good boots but soles are very slippery on ice and even when wet and you walk into a store down you go. The boots seem like they are one piece molded . Kind of plastic like. The shafts of mine are oval shaped and have stayed that way ,rubbing on my legs chafing them. The foot comfort improves with wear though not as comfortable as a competitors but the seams on that brand open letting water in. ( three pairs ) These keep my feet dry and warm have worn them in 15 degree weather for hours and my feet stayed warm enough to stay out doing chores no problem. All and all they get the job done but will keep searching for that just right boot that has it all.
review.name: Good boots but...

review.itemreviewed: Classic High Adjustable Calf Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Really good boots, I've never had a pair of boots keep my feet so warm and dry. I'm an arborist and these boots can really take the elements.
review.name: Best snow boots ever

review.itemreviewed: Classic High Adjustable Calf Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have had this boot for about 6 weeks now. It is very comfortable to wear in and out of the woods. Good support and well-constructed. I originally ordered a size 10 but just a little tight so exchanged for a size 11 and fits perfectly. Bogs exchange was easy and worked well. I think this was a great choice.
review.name: Comfortable and well-constructed

review.itemreviewed: Classic High Adjustable Calf Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: First boot was too small. Very easy return and reorder to get the correct size. Fit great.
review.name: Perfect garden boot

review.itemreviewed: Classic High Adjustable Calf Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: The bottom is not grippy for ice and snow. It is hard and slippery. I like the adjustment good for smaller or larger calves but the strap just hangs. Not thought out design.
review.name: Ok

review.itemreviewed: Classic High Adjustable Calf Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Warm, comfortable, fit well, wish they came in half sizes also.
review.name: Comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Classic High Adjustable Calf Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought these for my husband. He loves them. Warm for cold winter days feeding animals. Easy on/off. Will be great when mud season starts.
review.name: Comfortable. Great for different seasons

review.itemreviewed: Classic High Adjustable Calf Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: It's pretty well made, uses thicker materials which makes for a warmer boot. I'll be having fun with this boots coming winter time.
review.name: What can I say?

name: Classic High Adjustable Calf Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody:
This is the jack of all trades of Sun Hoodies. I've been using it for almost on all my outdoor activities. It's been a super modular and versatile ski touring layer as well as a climbing layer. 
The quarter chest zipper is great for dumping heat when you need to and the hood can either keep the sun or wind off of your neck. 
I went with a medium and it fits the way some other smalls fit me 
I'll need a few more as I live in it these days.

review.reviewBody:
Coghlan's Water Pump offers hassle-free hydration for any campsite
or backyard. This USB-Charged electric water pump installs on the
spout of standard sized cooler jugs in seconds, so you can drink
bottled water at your campsite, without having to waste single-use
bottles. With one-touch operation, it's easy enough for the whole
family to use. The pump can dispense up to 30 US Gal. (113 L) of water
on a single charge. The pump also comes with a weather-resistant
nylon cover to protect it against the elements.
? Includes water pump, hose, weather-resistant cover,
USB charging cord, and metal spout with gasket
? Also makes a great handwashing station
? For use with rigid water containers only
? Flow rate: approximately 70 fl. oz. (2 L) per minute
review.name: This thing is great!!

hasVariant.description: Buy the Lake MX219 Cycling Shoe - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I've owned the MX219's for close to a year now, they are the best shoes I've worn.
There are a few issues I've experienced, including the Boa not keeping my feet snug in the shoe, (easy to reach down & tighten while riding). Also, the L6 Boa can't be losened w/out pulling up and releasing, which is not easy on these.
I own the wide version of these, which really gives my feet enough room to spread & splay, (as Tony Post from Topo Athletic likes to say). I do have a good amount of heal lift when walking uphill in these, (I have not tried to heat them in the oven and form the heal, but may).

They've held up well, with little wear showing, (I do clean them regularly), and the Clarino material is tough enough to not show light scuffing, (I own the blue ones), and the "gum rubber" soles also clean up.
The breath-ability is good, and with a lighter sock, my feet stay fairly cool, (I removed the 2 toe bolts which may help a bit). Doing hike-a-bike's, the traction is good, with the large mid-sole lugs, just wish the heals where tighter. Not much flex in the carbon soles, (to be expected).
I wear an 11 in my hiking shoes, which is a 44 according to Lake's chart, but had to bump up to a 45 in these.
If you have a fairly wide foot and want more comfort in a well-made shoe, consider these. I will be moving up to another Lake shoe w 2 Boa's eventually, but the price on these is more reasonable. I use these both on my mt & road bike with Shimano cleats & XT (PD-M8120) pedals.
review.name: Good, wide shoe

name: MX219 Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Have been using as work pants for a year now. Hold up very well and are decently water resistant. As a bonus, got bit by a dog in these and only suffered a bruise + the pants were not damaged!
review.name: Great work pants!

review.reviewBody: I liked these pants but the rise was too short for me.  They would have been very uncomfortable.
review.name: Nice pants but did not fit well

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a more rugged pair of hiking pants and felt the Keb to be a little stiff so these seemed like a good alternative. Iâ€™ve used them several times now and have been happy with the function and pockets. Theyâ€™re not as comfortable as I was hoping, the waistband is a little sharp though the curved fit is really nice, and I find that the seam on the back and the waxed cotton fabric chafes on my bum during long hikes. By the end of the day I couldnâ€™t wait to take them off.
review.name: Great function, not the most comfortable

review.reviewBody:
Excellent quality, but I didn't realize it was the curved fit so clearly too large for me! I would also say that it is not straight pants but more a flare type. It is very long, but I believe it is meant to be tailored! I wore it once, and unfortunately, I got one stain that does not come off. I'm unsure what I do wrong when I wash it because all my Fjallraven pants have stains that never come off, which is annoying considering the price!  
I didn't return it because I was too busy then, which was an expensive mistake, but I am sure it is a great pair of pants!
review.name: Great Quality outdoor pants!

review.reviewBody: Iâ€™m 5â€™7â€, 125lbs, with a 32â€ inseam. And Iâ€™m a weight lifter, so itâ€™s incredibly difficult to find hiking pants that fit in the glutes. These pants fit perfectly. They are long enough, they have sufficient glute room, they actually stay in place when Iâ€™m moving and donâ€™t ride up/shift around. And, theyâ€™re flattering! And they have pockets such that my phone can fit without impinging my movement, or pulling down the pants. So glad I found these.
review.name: Canâ€™t recommend them enough

review.reviewBody: Although I had ordered the long version because I have long legs, I had never guessed that the trousers could be too long for me. I had to ask someone to shorten them. The pockets are very useful, eg on a citytrip. The trousers are a pleasure to wear and they look great. I love to wear them in the city and on nature hikes. Though they were expensive, I would not hesitate to buy them again. The fabric is very comfortable, also when you sit down.
review.name: Good pockets

review.reviewBody: Quite possibly the best hiking pants I have ever put on my body. Wore them around the house and for a fast hike in our state park, then promptly ordered a second pair in a different color. What's so great about them? 1) The fit - no gaping waist or restrictive booty, just enough stretch and support in all the right places - they very long and need folding or hemming ( I am 5'6", 26" waist, 36" hips, wear a size 4 in most bottoms, bought EU36 in these); 2) the tech - sturdy, flexy, breathable fabric, good hardware, lots of smart pockets; 3)  the look - snazzy details, shapely cut, great colors. I can hardly wait to wear them on long backcountry treks!
review.name: Look hot, stay cool

review.reviewBody: Fjallraven has quickly become my favorite brand. The curved line is especially great. I have several different pairs and the Nikka curved is the "dressiest" of them. The pockets are amazing and will ruin you for all other brands of pants. There's even a cell phone pouch inside of one of the bigger pockets so you don't have to go fishing for your phone. The styling is a bit more subtle on these, not quite as survival chic as the Kebs or the Vida Pros. As for sizing, I wear an EU 38 and I'm 5' 4", 130 lbs. They come with a very long inseam, and I will at some point hem them shorter, but for now I just roll them a couple times. The stretchy fabric is so comfortable and the rise is perfect, no plumber butt.
review.name: Amazing pants!

review.reviewBody: Not enough room in the crotch. Seriously people, how hard is it?
review.name: Super disappointing--weird fit

review.reviewBody: These are the best pants I own for outdoor use. I love the fabric, fit, and the pockets! I was concerned about sizing. For reference I wear size 30 in the Levi 721 High rise skinny jeans and usually find jeans don't fit my larger butt (gape at waistband). The size 40 fits me great. I also own the womens regular Vidda Pro's and prefer the fit of these pants.
review.name: My favourite hiking pants

name: Nikka Curved Trouser - Women's

comment: We appreciate your feedback. You can have the strap shortened if needed, get started at ReChaco.com. Thanks!

review.reviewBody: They were too big. Difficult to adjust to fit my foot.  The sole inside was rough.
review.name: Best for someone else.

review.reviewBody: Wide sandels  fits my native wide feet which is often hard to find. The strap was a bit too long since native feet are slender and not bulky. Overall Iâ€™m pleased.
review.name: Accommodating to Native feet
comment: Thank you for sharing your feedback Francine!

review.reviewBody: I love them!! My other pair of Z/2's is black and white and are pretty used and dirty, so I loved the bright rainbow coloring on these! They fit perfectly and are so, so comfortable. I wear them to work everyday (plus adventures on the weekends) and I'm glad to have two pairs in the rotation now!
review.name: Amazing!!

review.reviewBody: I like them but I there will be some time adjusting and breaking them in.
review.name: Adjustable strap sandals

review.reviewBody: I like how comfortable and stylish they are. My only issue is there isn't enough strap length. I have it pulled to the longest point and barely have enough room to get my foot in.
review.name: Comfy, durable but strap length too short

review.reviewBody: Love these sandals, on shore and on ground . Only thing is the strap is a little long so it drags on the ground
review.name: Amphibious sandals with lots of support
comment: Happy you love them! Thanks for sharing your feedback!

review.reviewBody: This is my fourth pair of Chaco sandals.  I couldn't resist the Ridge Gray Blue design, which I think is absolutely stunning!  My sandals fit well and are comfortable, now that they are adjusted to my taste.  I love the durability of Chaco sandals and the fact that they are great water shoes as well as everyday wear.  When I first received my sandals, the rubber smell of the sole was very strong, so I aired them out on the shoe rack in my entry way, rather than in my closet.
review.name: Comfortable and Great Looking Sandal
comment: Thanks Wendy! We're happy you love them!

review.reviewBody: I love the colors and pattern on this sandal! Fit is perfect as usual. I am a happy customer:)
review.name: Perfect Fit!
comment: Thanks Kris! We're happy you love them!

review.reviewBody: Wonderful.  I ordered this pair to replace my previous ones which were over 20 years old.  I loved that pair but after several repairs of the Vibram soles they just wouldn't accept another glueing.  I wore them in lots of national and state parks as summer hiking shoes and they were simply the best.  I can tell the new soles are not as sturdy but they feel great.  The newer soles allow my husband, who could not wear Chacos before, to become a fanatic with several pair.  I chose this color because it was my favorite of the clearance and they are a great-looking pair of sandals.  I would have chosen this pair anyway.
review.name: Best hiking sandals ever

name: Z/2 Classic Wide Sandal - Women's

review.reviewBody: This is my third pair in 10 years. I like tall boots for day hikes and activities because it holds my ankles. Some people live in their tennis shoes, I live in my Lowas. They are light weight and well made. However it is not an aggressive 10 days strenuous hike type boot, it is more relax casual short hikes ones. Only downside I found that I wear out shoe lases before I wear out boots and  sage colour shoe laces are not available for replacement, for example, so I just use paracord instead. Sizing is accurate as 39 European size is exactly US8 and they give it 1/2 size towards extra sock. As I read some sizing complaints I just wanted to give my two bits. Overall it is affordable and very well made boots.
review.name: My go to boots

review.reviewBody: I am new to backpacking and purchased 3 pairs of boots to try out. I love the sporty boot style, but worried that Iâ€™d need more support with a heavy pack. Also want a boot that looks good so color and style make a difference for me. After trying them all on with my pack, lots of reading reviews and articles the grey green/panna Lowaâ€™s were the easy choice. Happy to say that after many miles of backpacking it was the right choice. They now have a perfect fit to my foot, but it never felt like I was breaking them in, they were comfortable from the start. I ordered a half size larger boot based on sizing recommendations in hiking boot articles, and the 8 is a comfortable fit for my 7.5 size foot. Secure fit with thick or mid weight socks, they clean up nicely and keep my feet dry through water, muck, mud. Thank you Backcountry and Lowa for a great intro to backpacking!
review.name: Letâ€™s go!

review.reviewBody: I bought a pair for both my daughter and I. They were worth it. We went hiking sunny 3 times this past week and there were perfect. Also used them to the beach (Washington ) where it was cold so just wanted to see it. There were lots of rocks and of course wet. They worked perfectly and ARE waterproof. My entire foot was splashed by a huge wave. And another time we walked through a lake. Definitely kept our feet dry. I will be buying another pair for myself. I wear an 8 but the 7.5 fit me perfect.  No blisters left.
review.name: Love these !!

review.reviewBody: Poor quality boots. Not waterproof at all. My feet are soaked from walking across damp grass and stay wet all day.
review.name: Not waterproof at all

review.reviewBody: I normally don't write negative reviews ..but I think these should come with a warning. This is my third pair of hiking boots, I thought I would give a more expensive brand a try since I hike every weekend. I have a pair of Columbia's that had zero break in time, I had a pair of cheap Amazon $50 foxellis that were fantastic and crazy comfy, zero break in time, never one blister. These left horrible blisters on the back of both ankles within 2 miles of my hike. There is a bump on the heel inside the shoe, and because the shoe is so stiff you cannot stop it from rubbing even with Band-Aids and tape.  Also, because they are so stiff you constantly have to stop and tighten up the ankle when going uphill. There is nothing worse than having a gear failure so bad that you cannot finish your hike. And when I only have weekends to enjoy them, these boots made me very angry when I realized I had to turn around. Returned them. Horrible.
review.name: Horrible

review.reviewBody:
I got these for hiking - then in 2019 I had foot and ankle surgery, so they became my everyday shoe. I joke that these are my dress shoes, my flip-flops, my knock-around shoes and my slippers - I wear them all the time!
I find that they run true to size - also, I have full-foot orthotics, which work great in them when I remove the original footbed (which is removable - no effort at all).
After 6 years of owning them - with 2 Â° years of everyday wear - they are wearing out. 
I bought two pairs this time - two fun colors - so I really can change my mind. I suspect these will last me twice as long because of alternating between the two.
Can't wait to have fancy new shoes!
By the way - I love the colors - and for me - you could even do more fancy colors!
review.name: My everyday shoe after foot surgery

review.reviewBody:
I wore these boots for a year and found them to be quite comfortable.   I took meticulous care of them, cleaning the leather and the soles after every hike, hoping that I would get years of good use out of them.  When I was preparing to condition and waterproof them for the winter, with the Lowa brand conditioner and water proofing product,  I noticed a tear in the fabric inside, where they are laced.  I filled out a warranty claim and submitted it to Lowa, expecting that they would provide good customer service and offer to replace them, like other companies do, i.e., L.L. Bean. 

When I called Lowa Boots, the customer service rep informed me that the tear was considered "normal wear and tear" and that they would not fix them or send me a new pair.

For the price of $240, I would expect these boots would have held up better than they did.  I will never buy a Lowa product again.  Poor quality.  Poor customer support from Lowa Boots.
review.name: Buyer Beware-  Inferior Quality Product

review.reviewBody:
This is my fourth pair of Lowa hiking boots, third in this style, and as always they are perfect and comfy right out of the box with no break-in time required. I wear a 7.5 in shoes and that's what I always get for these boots as well. My feet are on the narrower side and slightly long, with a high arch/instep. Some brands are too wide and too short for me, but Lowas are always just right. Lightweight but warm and supportive, they are great all year round, including most of our cold, wet Michigan winters. I switch to taller boots when the snow cover is more than ankle deep, but these are great for all the rest of the time. I wear them pretty much every day for hikes in the woods with my dogs, and they hold up pretty well. 

However they don't seem to last quite as long as the Bora model from a few years ago (my first Lowas). Each time, within a year, the toes on my two previous pairs of Renegades developed cracks and started to come apart, which makes them pretty much useless unless the weather is warm and dry, which this is Michigan so forget it. Pretty disappointing for such an expensive boot, as I'd definitely rather not have to replace them annually after wearing them for an hour or two a day in pretty non-punishing conditions. Compare that to my Boras which lasted me a good couple of years of regular use including several backcountry trips on rough terrain in Arizona, including the Grand Canyon. Still, I have yet to find anything else as comfortable or that meets my needs as well as these. 

The only other issue is that the laces come loose as I walk unless I double-tie them, which is annoying to have to do and makes it impossible to adjust the instep and ankle to different degrees of tightness (as previous pairs have enabled). The bottom of the three speedhooks does not hold them tightly enough, so if you like your fit looser at the instep and tighter around the ankle (which I do), forget it, because that hook won't hold it firmly enough to allow this and eventually the looseness will work itself all the way up until you have no ankle support whatsoever and you'll have to stop and fuss with it, which is annoying.
review.name: Love my Lowas!

review.reviewBody:
I wanted to love these boots - my husband has a pair of Lowa's and my best friend also has a pair of Lowa's.(they both love them).     I could not find a local place to purchase or even try them on.  I wear an 8 1/2 Salomon - fit perfectly , several pair and styles, but I wanted a true backcountry backpacking boot - which Salomon does not appear to offer.   So I took a chance on getting Lowa 8 1/2 - it was too small.   I don't want to order the 9 without actually trying on some Lowa boots - because of the shipping / return timeline.  

My return was been received - but still not showing in my backcountry order history or my bank account...   So I have to wait to get the right boots.
review.name: Nice boot - not true to size for me
comment: Hi Cynthia, thanks for your review. I am sorry to hear that these did not fit true to size for you. I'd be happy to help get your return processed and help you order the size 9. I've sent you an email to follow up!

review.reviewBody:
I really wanted to love these boots as there are many great features about them. 

I took these on a 3-day backpacking trip recently and after the first day, they gave both my feet (the back of the heel region) blisters (in identical spots on both feet). They felt like they fit my foot everywhere else (I have fairly narrow feet), and my toes were not jamming into the front of the boot (even with thick wool socks). However, when I tried them on straight out of the package, I noticed that there was a sort of protrusion at the heel region inside the shoe (those should have been alarm bells!) that was just slightly rubbing against my heel when I walked around the house (not at all painful at the time). I think they were the right size (8 US) but the interior of the shoe at the heel just wasn't a great fit and rather odd.

As a few pros: they are light, easy to put on and take off while being able to tighten properly with lacing, good ankle support, and waterproof.
review.name: Wanted to love these boots but couldn't

name: Renegade GTX Mid Boot - Women's
